newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia Yield Spreads-100 bp holds to U.S..
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia Yield Spreads-100 bp holds to U.S..

text.p: The Australian/U.S. 10-year bond yield spread blew out to 100 basis points following today's release of a stronger than expected employment data for January, but this again proved a buying opportunity.

However, spreads to the dollar bloc generally ended wider on the day, particularly at the short-end, as the jobs data put another dent in any remaining speculation of a further easing domestic monetary policy.

The dashed hopes of a rate cut also saw the yield curve flatten once again with the three/10-year bond futures spread falling to around 76 basis points at one stage, its lowest level since the December 11 official interest rate cut to 6.0 percent.
This margin exceeded 100 basis points at the end of last month when rate cut speculation was at its peak.

U.S. Treasuries were generally flat, although sentiment was mildly bearish following a weak response to Wednesday's 10-year note auction and ahead of the US$10.0 billion 30-year bond sale later today, the last leg of the quarterly refunding.
